Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear just made an executive order mandating that every Kentuckian must wear a mask when in public, beginning Friday at 5:00 P.M. The mandate requires "all customers in retail facilities, grocery stores, anywhere indoors where people cannot stay six feet apart from each other, must wear a mask. The same guidelines adhere to outdoor locations as well if people cannot stay six feet apart. If customers in these businesses refuse to wear a mask, businesses can refuse to serve them. Gov. Beshear says the executive order will continue for 30 days and will be re-evaluated after that." So to those of you going to the beach or lake or any other type of outdoor recreational activities - masks are a requirement for those places as well.
